gobblin.data.management.retention.dataset

Class DatasetBase<T extends DatasetVersion>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.data.management.retention.dataset.DatasetBase<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of DatasetVersion supported by this CleanableDataset.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CleanableDataset, Dataset
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfigurableDataset, ModificationTimeDataset, RawDataset, SnapshotDataset, TrackingDataset

    public abstract class DatasetBase<T extends DatasetVersion>
extends Object
implements CleanableDataset
    Implementation of a CleanableDataset that uses a VersionFinder to find dataset versions, a RetentionPolicy to figure out deletable versions, and then deletes those files and newly empty parent directories.

    Concrete subclasses should implement getVersionFinder() and getRetentionPolicy().

    Datasets are directories in the filesystem containing data files organized in version-like directory structures. Example datasets:

    For snapshot based datasets, with the directory structure: 

       /path/to/table/
      snapshot1/
          dataFiles...
      snapshot2/
          dataFiles...
    each of snapshot1 and snapshot2 are dataset versions.

    For tracking datasets, with the directory structure: 

       /path/to/tracking/data/
      2015/
          06/
              01/
                  dataFiles...
              02/
                  dataFiles...
    each of 2015/06/01 and 2015/06/02 are dataset versions.

    DatasetBase uses a DatasetVersionFinder to find all subdirectories that are versions of this dataset. After that, for each dataset, it uses a RetentionPolicy to decide which versions of the dataset should be deleted. For each version deleted, if deleteEmptyDirectories it will also look at all parent directories and delete directories that are now empty, up to but not including the dataset root.

      • DatasetBase

        public DatasetBase(FileSystem fs,
                   Properties properties,
                   boolean simulate,
                   boolean skipTrash,
                   boolean deleteEmptyDirectories,
                   boolean deleteAsOwner,
                   org.slf4j.Logger log)
            throws IOException
        Constructor for DatasetBase.
        Parameters:
        fs - FileSystem where files are located.
        properties - Properties for object.
        simulate - whether to simulate deletes.
        skipTrash - if true, delete files and directories immediately.
        deleteEmptyDirectories - if true, newly empty parent directories will be deleted.
        deleteAsOwner - if true, all deletions will be executed as the owner of the file / directory.
        log - logger to use.
        Throws:
        IOException
